specific_learning_outcomes: identify themselves as male or female according to Genesis 1:27
describe how they cope with happy or sad feelings
make the right choices guided by the word of God
appreciate his or her gender as guided by the scriptures
suggested_learning_experiences: read Genesis 1:27 and state their gender
list different activities done by boys and girls
write Psalms 139:13 on flashcards and read aloud
draw and colour faces depicting various emotions
in groups list good thoughts and feelings e.g. loving others, loving God, having joy, forgiving others
sing a song ‘I’m happy today so happy in Jesus name I’m happy…
avoid bad thoughts which can lead to bad behaviour, such as fights, stealing, hating others, abusing others, and talking about other people behind their back
list results of making bad choices and share in class
key_inquiry_questions: Why is it important to appreciate your gender?

specific_learning_outcomes: name family members in the nuclear and extended family
draw the family tree to understand family relationships
desire to respect family members for harmonious living
suggested_learning_experiences: name members of their family
tell how they relate with family members
draw and colour the family tree
compose a poem to appreciate members of their families
key_inquiry_questions: Why should you respect family members?

specific_learning_outcomes: recognise God as the creator of Adam and Eve
describe how Adam and Eve disobeyed God
state four results of Adam’s disobedience
desire to exercise obedience in day-to-day life
suggested_learning_experiences: picture-read Genesis 2:7, 21
picture-read Genesis 2:16-17
tell how man disobeyed God in Genesis 3:6-7
mention the result of man’s disobedience; Genesis 3:17, 19 & 23
compose a poem on the importance of obeying parents
key_inquiry_questions: How did Adam and Eve disobey God?
Why should you obey your parents?

substrands.substrand_name: The Bible as the Word of God
specific_learning_outcomes: differentiate the Bible from other books as guided in 2 Timothy 3:16A
state the number of books in the New Testament
name the four Gospel books in the New Testament
appreciate the Bible as a guide in their daily life
suggested_learning_experiences: in pairs, tell the difference between the Bible and other books
in groups, draw and colour the Holy Bible
sing the song “My Bible and I”
in groups read 2 Timothy 3:16A and say why they should respect the Holy Bible
state the number of books in the New Testament
name the four Gospel books
tell the importance of reading the Bible always
recite Psalms 119:105
key_inquiry_questions: Why is the Bible a Holy book?

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the story of Moses and the burning bush
mention three lessons learnt from the story
desire to obey God in their day-to-day lives
suggested_learning_experiences: in turns read Exodus 3:1-6
watch a video clip of Moses and the burning bush
in pairs state how Moses obeyed God
mention three lessons learnt from the story of Moses and the burning bush
sing a song about Moses and the burning bush
draw and colour Moses and the burning bush
in pairs share experiences of how they obey their parents
key_inquiry_questions: How did Moses express obedience to God?

specific_learning_outcomes: narrate the story of Jonah and the big fish
list the results of Jonah’s disobedience
desire to obey God in day-to-day life
suggested_learning_experiences: read the story of Jonah 1:1-4,15,17; 2:10
watch a video on the story of Jonah
draw and colour the big fish
mention what happened to Jonah after he disobeyed God
state why they should be obedient to God and others
sing a song, “The big fish swallows Jonah…”
key_inquiry_questions: Why is it important to obey God?

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the healing of Naaman the Syrian commander
mention three lessons learnt from the story of Naaman
appreciate God as the healer of all diseases
suggested_learning_experiences: know what is leprosy and how it is spread from one person to the other
picture-read the healing of Naaman in 2 Kings 5:1-14
watch a video clip on Naaman’s healing
dramatise the story of Naaman
list three lessons learnt from the healing of Naaman
key_inquiry_questions: How was Naaman healed?

specific_learning_outcomes: narrate the story of the three Hebrew men
list three lessons learnt from the story
desire to depend on God when faced with challenges
suggested_learning_experiences: picture-read Daniel 3:15-16, 18, 23-30
watch a video on the story
tell why the three men were thrown into the fire
draw and colour the three Hebrew men and the fourth person who rescued them
mention lessons learnt from the story
dramatise how the three Hebrew men were rescued
sing a song based on the story
key_inquiry_questions: How were the three Hebrew men rescued from the fire?

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the story of Elisha and the boys
mention four lessons learnt from the story of Elisha and the boys
desire to respect the elderly in the community
suggested_learning_experiences: read 2 Kings 2: 23-24 and retell the story of Elisha and the boys
mention the number of boys in the story
draw, colour, and display pictures of the two bears
in pairs tell why they should respect the elderly
say why they should not join their friends to do mischief
role-play the story of Elisha and the boys
compose a poem on how to respect the elderly in society
key_inquiry_questions: How did Elisha respond to the boys who insulted him?

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the story of the wise men
name the hometown of Jesus Christ
desire to be led by God in day-to-day life
suggested_learning_experiences: in pairs read Matt 2:1-2
watch a video clip on the wise men from the East
in groups role-play the story of the wise men
draw stars and colour them
in pairs mention their home towns
say what they like about their hometowns
name the town where Jesus grew up; Luke 2: 39- 40
compose simple poems about their hometowns
key_inquiry_questions: Why is the birth of Jesus Christ important to us?

specific_learning_outcomes: narrate the story of the Good Samaritan
list four lessons learnt from the story of the Good Samaritan
desire to show kindness to people in need
suggested_learning_experiences: read Luke 10:30-37 in turns
watch a video on the story of the Good Samaritan
role-play the story of the Good Samaritan
mention lessons learnt from the story of the Good Samaritan
tell how they help people in need
sing a song about the Good Samaritan
key_inquiry_questions: How did the Good Samaritan show kindness?

substrands.substrand_name: The Little boy with five loaves and two fish
specific_learning_outcomes: retell the miracle of the five loaves and two fish
state lessons learnt from the miracle of five loaves and two fish
desire to show kindness to those in need
suggested_learning_experiences: picture-read John 6:1-14
watch a video of the little boy with five loaves and two fish
narrate the story of the little boy with five loaves and two fish
role-play the miracle
tell how they keep the environment clean
share experiences; on how they show kindness to others
tell how many baskets remained after feeding the people
draw the two fish and five loaves of bread
compose a poem on how to avoid food wastage
sing a song about the five loaves and two fish
key_inquiry_questions: Why is the story of the little boy important to Christians today?

specific_learning_outcomes: narrate the miracle of Jesus Christ walking on water
list lessons learnt from the miracle
appreciate Jesus’ power over nature
suggested_learning_experiences: picture-read Mathew 14:22-33
discuss why the disciples were frightened (Mathew 14:26) in groups
watch a video on Jesus walking on water
draw a picture of Jesus walking on water in groups
sing a song about Jesus walking on water
key_inquiry_questions: How does this miracle portray God’s Power over nature?

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the miracle of raising Jairus’ daughter
list four lessons learnt from the miracle of healing Jairus’ daughter
recognise Jesus Christ’s power over life and death
suggested_learning_experiences: read Mark 5:35-43 in turns
retell the story of raising Jairus’ daughter
write Mark 5:41on a speech bubble and display it in the CRE learning corner
watch a video clip on the raising of Jairus’ daughter
sing a song on the raising of Jairus’ daughter
key_inquiry_questions: How did Jairus portray faith in God?

specific_learning_outcomes: mention the importance of celebrating Easter
identify the events that take place during Easter celebrations
appreciate Jesus Christ’s resurrection by taking part in Easter celebrations
suggested_learning_experiences: share experiences of how they celebrate Easter
list in groups the importance of celebrating Easter
list the activities that take place during Easter celebrations
picture-read Mathew 28:1-6 in pairs
write Matthew 28:6 on flashcards and read aloud
sing songs about the resurrection of Jesus Christ
key_inquiry_questions: Why do Christians celebrate Easter?

specific_learning_outcomes: narrate the story of Ananias and Sapphira
practise honesty by taking offerings given by parents to church
explain the importance of respecting other people’s property
desire to exercise honesty in day-to-day life
suggested_learning_experiences: picture-read the story of Ananias and Sapphira in Acts 5:1-11
watch a video clip about Ananias and Sapphira
mention lessons learnt from the story of Ananias and Sapphira
in groups sing a song on honesty
say why they should not use church offerings for other purposes
in groups, role-play ways of respecting other people’s properties
key_inquiry_questions: Why should you practise honesty as a Christian?
Why should you respect other people’s property?

specific_learning_outcomes: list ways they thank God in day-to-day life
state five reasons for thanking God for their family, friends, and teachers
desire to thank God in day-to-day life
suggested_learning_experiences: write Psalms 136:1 on flashcards and read it aloud in class
in pairs tell why they should thank God
write on flashcards reasons for thanking God, family, friends, and teachers
make cards to thank God and mount them at the CRE learning corner
role-play in groups various ways of thanking God for family, friends, and teachers
participate in singing games with a theme, ‘thank you God’
say a simple, ‘Thank you’ prayer to God
key_inquiry_questions: Why should you thank God for your family, friends and teachers?

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the story of the unforgiving servant
dramatise the story of the unforgiving servant
desire to forgive others in their day- to-day lives
suggested_learning_experiences: observe and read pictures of the unforgiving servant (Matthew 18:21-31)
watch a video on the unforgiving servant
role-play the story of the unforgiving servant
always say, ‘Sorry’ when they wrong others
write Colossians 3:13 on flashcards and read aloud in turns
say what to do when wronged by others; Colossians 3:13
play a game on forgiveness
key_inquiry_questions: Why should you forgive others?

specific_learning_outcomes: identify people they can trust for their own safety
mention three people to report to when molested or touched inappropriately
stay safe by reporting people who molest them
suggested_learning_experiences: list people they can trust for their own safety
mention the people to report to in case they are molested or touched inappropriately
role-play how to behave when confronted by a stranger
sing the song, “Trust and obey”
read and recite Proverbs 11:13
key_inquiry_questions: How do you ensure personal safety?

specific_learning_outcomes: practise cleanliness at home and school
demonstrate responsibility by correcting those in the wrong
carry out chores at home without expecting a reward
desire to be responsible in day-to-day life
suggested_learning_experiences: mention the importance of personal hygiene and good grooming
report students who play mischief
mention chores they do at home
say why they should not expect rewards after doing chores at home
recite Philippians 2:4
key_inquiry_questions: Why is personal hygiene important?
How do show responsibility at home?

specific_learning_outcomes: recite the Lord’s prayer in Mathew 6:9-13
use appropriate postures during prayer
desire to show respect to God when praying
suggested_learning_experiences: recite the Lord’s prayer, Matthew 6:9-13
read the Lord’s prayer from a chart displayed in class
role-play ways of showing respect to God during prayers
say the Lord’s prayer at home or in church
sing songs related to the Lord’s prayer
key_inquiry_questions: Why is it important to pray?
How do you show respect to God during prayer?

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the coming of the Holy Spirit on the day of Pentecost
identify the work of the Holy Spirit in the life of a Christian
identify five fruit of the Holy Spirit
desire to be led by the Holy Spirit as they make decisions in life
suggested_learning_experiences: read Acts 2:1-4 in turns
watch a video clip on the coming of the Holy Spirit
mention the work of the Holy Spirit in pairs
read Galatians 5:22 and list the fruit of the Holy Spirit
draw a tree and write the fruit of the Holy Spirit (love, joy, peace, patience, and kindness)
learners to model and label five fruit of the Holy Spirit (love, joy, peace, patience, and kindness)
sing songs about the fruit of Holy Spirit
key_inquiry_questions: Why is the Holy Spirit important in the life of a Christian?
